title: Arecibo - Trans Plutonian Transmissions (FLAC lossless)
description:
Arecibo
Trans Plutonian Transmissions
Atmosphere Compact Disc 002 1994

01 NGC 5128: Receiving Station Alignment (10:39)
02 3C147: Beyond The Heart Of Space (13:45)
03 M87: The Four Second Timing Discrepancy (11:18)
04 NGC 5426: Unified Field Modulation (7:30)
05 NGC 5427: Anomalous Intermittent Radio Source (10:13)
06 3C295: Pulse Burst Decryption (11:56)

Constructed and produced by B. Lustmord with many of the sounds on "Trans Plutonian Transmissions" derived from cosmological activity as recorded by NASA&#039;s deep space network.

As promised: I found the CD and am upping two torrents: a hi-bitrate MP3 one and a flac lossless one. Also included are hi-res scans of the covers and CD disc. Tracks fully tagged with cover art. This is the best available version of this HTF OOP CD on teh Interweb.

** This is the FLAC version **

Great space music from Lustmord recording as Arecibo.

Designed, compiled and produced by B. Lustmord at Scientific Electric, Los Angeles, March-August 1994. Many of the sounds on "Trans Plutonian Transmissions" are derived from cosmological activity as recorded by NASA&#039;s deep space network.

"Under the pseudonym Arecibo, Brian Lustmord [sic] made "Trans plutonian transmissions", an album that uses cosmic sounds (like pulsars, quasars, thermal radiation, electron partical interaction and even the remains of supernova explosions) as pirmal source and creates music that seems to come from light years away and is, on certain moments, as dark and old as the universe itself."
